faq.q1: How does AmanVision detect a fall?
faq.a1: Our AI analyzes video streams in real-time to identify key points of the human body (digital skeleton). It instantly recognizes characteristic posture changes of a fall, even in complex environments.
faq.q2: What type of cameras need to be installed?
faq.a2: The system is agnostic: it works with most existing CCTV cameras (IP, converted analog). No installation of wearable sensors on people is necessary.
faq.q3: Does the system record faces or identity?
faq.a3: No. To guarantee privacy (GDPR), we only process shapes and movements (poses). No permanent recording is made and no facial recognition is used.
faq.q4: Does the system work in the dark?
faq.a4: Yes, provided your cameras have infrared night vision. The AI is trained to interpret black and white streams from IR sensors.
faq.q5: What is the real delay of an alert?
faq.a5: Detection takes place in less than 0.8 seconds. The alert is transmitted instantly via our Cloud platform to your mobiles or security PCs.
faq.q6: Is it suitable for construction sites or industrial environments?
faq.a6: Absolutely. AmanVision ignores machinery and tool movements to focus solely on human postures and distress situations (lone worker, malaise).
faq.q7: What happens in case of power or internet outage?
faq.a7: We offer local Edge-AI gateways that continue analysis even without internet. For power, the use of a standard UPS protects the detection hardware.
faq.q8: Can I install it at my home for a loved one?
faq.a8: Yes, our 'Aman Personal' offer is specifically designed for seniors living alone. It allows benevolent monitoring without intrusion into privacy.
faq.q9: Can the system distinguish an animal from a person?
faq.a9: Yes. The algorithm is trained to filter pets (dogs, cats) and only triggers on the human biomechanical structure.
faq.q10: What are the legal obligations for installation?
faq.a10: For companies, it is enough to inform employees and update the GDPR register. We provide all template documents and necessary signage for mandatory display.
